a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Historical Index of Human Development: with GDP metric vs.
The Historical Index of Human Development (HIHD) is a summary measure of average achievement in key dimensions of human
development: life expectancy, literacy rates, educational enrolment, and GDP per capita. This is shown below using an index which
does include GDP versus the index without GDP.
Data source: Leandro Prados de la Escosura (2018)
